MajorClaims.Text: public museums and art galleries will still be necessary
we still need museums and art galleries

Claims.Text: we can see the art works and historical objects online
computers can be introduced to museums and galleries in order to help visitors to know more about the art works or historical objects
Most people nowadays prefer to use the Internet to search for art work
In order to help visitors to learn more about the exhibits, museums hold various activities which make visitors be part of what they are seeing
Seeing an art work on computer screen is not the same as you watch it by your own eyes

Premises.Text: the Internet really brings them convenience
pictures online are only limited to a screen size
the exhibits in museums or galleries are all life size and visitors can get a more direct felling
only when we see the real mummy, can we experience mystique
We can browse the art work from all over the world at home
people may not get a spiritual experience
at American Museum of Natural History, you can make a bone-by-bone reproduction of the museum's stegosaurus
at Museum of Art in New York, you can look at 17th century instruments while listening to their music
While if you "visit" the museum online, you may not able to get this kind of experience
you can't see the texture of the artwork which is very important to study the skills used by the artist
not all the details of the artwork can be shown on the computer screen
the resolution ratio of the screen is not high enough
These may influence the comprehension of the art work or historical objects
